content.description:
Sit start with a decent right hand edge and a poor left hand edge. From there, gain the great left hand edge, crank up using the right hand sidepull to reach a decent edge, follow to the right hand jug, use the left hand arete, and gain the edges/bumps on top to reach an easy mantel.

Bailing to the right is possible at the halfway point. This one climbs direct up the boulder's apex.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Peacebone's west boulder.

content.description: Stand start with a high right hand edge. From there, achieve decent footing to gain the better bumps above and an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing has a rock that pads well.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Peacebone's west boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge. From there, gain a good right hand, bump it as far up as you can reach, follow to a sloping left hand edge, and continue up the spine for an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is shared with a few rocks, but it pads well.
content.location: It climbs the west arete of Peacebone's east boulder.

content.description: Stand start with left hand sloper and a high right hand edge. From there, use a small toe jib to drive up to the shelf, commit to the great sidepull with feet pasted, and finish with an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad or two. It has good landing, but there is a rock directly left of where the problem climbs.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Peacebone's east boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge at the lip. From there, work slightly right to a better edge, and continue up using the good bumps above to mantel onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The immediate landing is great, but it's surrounded by other boulders.
content.location: It climbs the east face of the west boulder of the pair's south cubby.
